name: SPANDx
short_description:
SPANDx is a versatile and customisable tool for the processing of large NGS datasets from raw reads to comparative analysis into a single tool. SPANDx performs alignment of NGS reads against the user’s chosen reference genome or pan-genome, followed by accurate variant calling and annotation, and presence/absence determination. SPANDx identifies the core genome and produces single-nucleotide polymorphism matrices for downstream phylogenetic analyses. Annotated, genome-wide SNPs and indels are identified and output in human readable format. In addition, a presence/absence analysis is performed allowing the identification of the core/accessory genome content.

SPANDx is designed to run in a cluster environment and utilises PBS or SGE for task parallelisation. 
SPANDx v2.6+ includes Generateplink.sh to convert outputs from SPANDx into PLINK format for haploid GWAS. See the SPANDx manual (v2.2) for more detailed usage.
